definition: a word or saying used by adherents of a party, sect, or belief and usually regarded by others as empty of real meaning
examples: the old shibboleths come rolling off their lips
today this book publishing shibboleth is a myth
some truth in the shibboleth that crime does not pay

definition: a use of language regarded as distinctive of a particular group
examples: accent was … a shibboleth of social class

definition: a custom or usage regarded as distinguishing one group from others
examples: for most of the well-to-do in the town, dinner was a shibboleth, its hour dividing mankind
